intro: Bubbia polyneura, commonly known as the slender burr grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Bubbia polyneura is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in coastal and inland dunes.
